definition: to put down a revolt/to pacify a rebellion
surname Ping
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
to betray/to rebel/to revolt

sentences.english: Just now, Afghanistan needs foreign troops to undertake COIN.
sentences.chinese: 眼下，阿富汗依然需要外国军队进行平叛。

sentences.english: Anti-terrorism gave way to its much more potent cousin, anti-insurgency.
sentences.chinese: 反恐让路给了其更有力的表亲，平叛。

sentences.english: As for the counterinsurgency campaign—this summer is going to be a critical period.
sentences.chinese: 对于平叛行动来上，今年夏天会是一个关键时期。

sentences.english: Our counterinsurgency campaign in Afghanistan is really focused on winning the people.
sentences.chinese: 而我们在阿富汗的平叛运动的真正着眼点是赢得民心。

definition: armed rebellion
to pacify
Pingding county in Yangquan 陽泉|阳泉[Yang2 quan2], Shanxi
to go on a punitive expedition
punitive expedition to the south
to take to the field oneself (of emperor)/to take part in person in an expedition
to serve the king diligently/to save the country in times of danger/to send troops to rescue the king
punitive expedition to the north
to mount a punitive expedition against bandits
punitive expedition to the west
to send armed forces to suppress
the emperor leads his troops into battle (idiom)/to take part personally in an expedition
to dispatch an army/to send troops
to send troops
the Northern Expedition, the Nationalists' campaign of 1926-1928 under Chiang Kai-shek, against the rule of local warlords
